intro: Sesamum eriocarpum, commonly known as the woolly sesame, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. Its seeds are typically small and oval, with a mild, nutty aroma. Sesamum eriocarpum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
